name: Utilities XLU Interest Rate Sensitivity Analysis
question: How has XLU performed during different interest rate cycles and Fed policy changes?
retailQuestion: Should I buy utility stocks when interest rates are falling?
description: Analyzes the Utilities Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLU) performance across various Federal Reserve policy cycles over 20 years. Examines sensitivity to 10-year Treasury yields, Fed rate changes, and yield curve movements to determine optimal timing for utility sector investments based on interest rate environment.

workflow.description: Step 1: Get 20+ years of XLU data covering multiple Fed cycles
Step 2: Get current XLU market data for rate environment context
Step 3: Analyze correlation between XLU performance and interest rate changes
Step 4: Backtest rate-based utility timing strategy with Fed policy signals
Step 5: Determine optimal allocation timing based on rate cycle positioning

followUp: Should I buy utilities when the Fed starts cutting rates?
Are utility stocks still good dividend investments when rates are high?
How do rising rates affect utility stock prices?
Is there a better time to invest in defensive sectors?
